node.title: 'The risk is too great': Health Minister defends Queensland's quarantine requirements for overseas arrivals
node.alt: Queensland Health Minister Yvette D'Ath provides COVID-19 update at North Lakes Sports Club
node.description: Queensland's Health Minister Yvette D'Ath stands firm on her decision to mandate hotel quarantine for returning overseas travellers after state borders open to interstate COVID hotspots next month.
node.content:
["Queensland's Health Minister\u00a0is standing firm on a\u00a0decision to require\u00a0hotel quarantine for returning overseas travellers\u00a0after state borders open up to people from\u00a0interstate COVID-19 hotspots next month.", "It comes as Queensland records another day of no new\u00a0cases in the state, however new exposure site details\u00a0have\u00a0been listed for a\u00a0Goondiwindi truck stop after a truck driver passed through on the weekend before testing positive interstate.", "Health Minister Yvette D'Ath has hit back at criticism\u00a0the state's international-traveller quarantine plans\u00a0are\u00a0out of line with other states that have already resumed quarantine-free international travel.", "Queensland is inching closer to reaching its target of 80 per cent vaccination of Queenslanders over 16, at which point\u00a0quarantine would\u00a0no longer be required for people arriving from interstate hotspots.", "International arrivals\u00a0will need to quarantine\u00a0until the vaccination rate hits 90 per cent.", "Ms D'Ath\u00a0said she would not\u00a0be swayed.", "\"Until that time the risk is too great,\" she said.", "\"What other states are choosing to do in letting people come in, that is their prerogative,\" she said.", "\"But while we have this rule, if they have travelled overseas on the last 14 days and seek to come into Queensland before that 14 days is up, they will have to quarantine in some way.\"", "Ms D'Ath said 64.71 per cent of Queenslanders over 16 were fully vaccinated against the virus and 78.21 per cent had received their first dose of a vaccine.", "Victoria and New South Wales, which have a much higher vaccination rate, have scrapped mandatory quarantine requirements for international arrivals.", "\"The difference between Queensland, New South Wales and Victoria right now is they've got far higher vaccination rates,\" Ms D'Ath said.", "\"Thirty per cent of our population are not double dosed ... so we need to get the vaccination rates higher.", "\"That's the difference.\"", "", "
Acting Chief Health Officer Peter Aitken encouraged more people to get their COVID vaccinations to ensure less of the disease in Queensland.
", "Acting Chief Health Officer Peter Aitken retaining the restrictions was \"about managing the risk\".\u00a0", "\"It means we have less people of that high-risk group coming into Queensland and less likelihood that we will get those cases appearing in Queensland, which means less risk\u00a0to our community and less impact to our hospital system,\" he said.", "
New COVID-19 exposure sites listed
", "The interstate driver was infectious while in Queensland on October 31\u00a0and has since left the state, Queensland Health said in a statement.", "Anyone who was at the Goondiwindi BP Truckstop on the Cunningham Highway between 10:30am and 11:00am has been told to get tested for the virus.", "Goondiwindi has one of the highest vaccination rates in Queensland."]
